meanings.definition: Approach and address (someone) boldly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The stranger accosted me on the street, demanding money.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson accosted every customer who entered the store.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel accosted the bird feeder, determined to get some seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds accosted the peaceful sky, bringing thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The detective accosted the suspect with tough questions, trying to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To approach and speak to (someone) in an aggressive or hostile manner.
meanings.sent1: The bully accosted the smaller kid during recess, demanding his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive driver accosted the pedestrian crossing the street.
meanings.sent3: The cat accosted the dog, hissing and swatting at its tail.
meanings.sent4: The loud music accosted my ears as I entered the party.
meanings.sent5: The angry customer accosted the manager, complaining loudly about the service.
